profile_english: Soonson is a DevRel Program Manager at Google working on various programs for the global Machine Learning Ecosystem. He is also the founder of KLDP.org, Korea’s biggest and oldest Open Source community which started as his small personal homepage in 1996. For +8 years, he spent a minimum of 4 hours every day managing and building up the community as a hobby even when he got employed, got married and became a dad. During this period, he acted not only as an engineer doing all the hacks and coding but also as a self-taught advocate of Linux and Open Source doing all kinds of DevRel activities. He never imagined that would become his job in the future.
profile_your_language: 권순선님은 Google의 DevRel 프로그램 관리자로 글로벌 머신 러닝 생태계를 위한 다양한 프로그램을 담당하고 있습니다. 또한 1996년에 소규모 개인 홈페이지로 시작한 한국에서 가장 크고 오래된 오픈소스 커뮤니티인 KLDP.org의 창립자이기도 합니다. 8년 이상의 기간 동안 취직, 결혼, 아빠가 되었을 때에도 취미로 커뮤니티를 관리하고 구축하는데 매일 최소 4 시간을 보냈습니다. 이 기간 동안 온갖 문제 해결과 코딩을 하는 엔지니어 역할을 했을 뿐만 아니라, 모든 종류의 DevRel 활동을 수행하면서 Linux 및 Open Source의 독학 전도사로 활동했습니다. 그것이 미래에 본업이 될 것이라고는 상상도 못했습니다.
speaker: true

profile_english:
I am passionate about bridging the chasm of understanding between companies and their customers - whether consumers or developers - through data and research. My life’s mission is to try to make the world a slightly better place, even in an infinitesimal way, by advancing fact-based knowledge, promoting understanding and cooperation between communities. I have a long track record of more than 20 years of research innovation, advocating data science techniques and leading the setup of algorithm-based decision making processes and systems (such as recommendation systems) in large organisations before they were widely known or acceptable and even before ‘data science' was a term. I have built from scratch several data teams, leading them to produce sophisticated customer and developer research that answers the ‘why’ and not just the ‘what’. I have repeatedly worked alongside senior management teams and offered recommendations on targeted marketing strategies based on segmentation, proving - always based on data! - the effectiveness of such strategies.
As the Senior Director of Research, I am responsible for all SlashData’s research products and I head the analyst and product teams.

profile_english:
Elastic Technical Product Marketing Manager/Evangelist.
I’d joined Microsoft Japan in 2003 and had been a Technical Architect in the public sector sales department, where he was responsible for raising awareness of .NET technology.
In 2006, I had been transferred to the Developer Marketing Division, where I worked for 10 years as a technical evangelist in charge of technology education for iOS/Android and Microsoft Azure developers. 
After retiring from Microsoft Japan, I worked for Dell, Accenture, and others, and was appointed as an Executive Advisor to the Government CIO of the Cabinet Secretariat in April 2019. 
I have been leading the planning, development, and design of new government systems to realize the Declaration of the Most Advanced IT Nation from a cloud-by-default perspective.
After serving as an evangelist at Cloud Venture in a dual role with an Executive Advisor to the Government CIO, I began working at Elastic in June 2020 and has been consistently involved in technology awareness activities and developer technology awareness for 17 years.

profile_english: Don Goodman-Wilson, Founder is a philosopher-engineer who focuses on ethics in tech and empowering software maintainers. profile_english: Renaldi Gondosubroto is the Founder of GReS Studio and a Developer Advocate in the tech community. His personal vision is to be able to get more young minds into taking leadership positions in the companies that will come. Through his passion of developing software and contributing to the opensource community, Renaldi wants to encourage the innovation of new solutions to usher forward and promote a new era of innovations that can be used by everyone. He enjoys sharing his knowledge regarding his experiences within the tech industry with many other people in order to also inspire and put them in the right track for success, both in conferences and in regular everyday situations. As part of this, he has been a tech speaker in numerous events for the past four years and runs tech meetups and workshops to promote better understanding of technical skills. In his free time, he also enjoys track running and playing chess.

profile_english: An ecosystem builder, working at Gojek Singapore, Vaibhavi describes herself as an explorer, learner and leader. She currently runs the Data & Diversity programs at Gojek, impacting multiple products & teams at scale. Previously, she worked at Google in Singapore and India where she initiated and scaled multiple programs around Machine Learning, Computer Science education, D&I and more - for enterprises, startups and developer communities across India, Southeast Asia, EMEA and LATAM markets. Being a Google Women Techmakers Scholar herself, her personal crusade revolves around getting more women involved in tech – whether they are school children, office professionals, home makers or elderly women - collaborating with various NGOs in Singapore and India on various projects. Outside of work, Vaibhavi is a keen reader, loving the mythological poems and stories of ancient India and discovering how the stories could fit in our modern world. Not only does she enjoy the written word, she has always been a keen dancer, learning kathak, a classical Indian dance form.

profile_english: Mary Thengvall is a connector of people at heart, personally and professionally. profile_english: Sandra Persing is the co-founder and producer of DevRel Summit leadership conference, the executive producer of View Source Conference, founder of Women Who Code CONNECT, and confidently claims on having once produced over 57 Developer Roadshows in one year. In the recent five years, Sandra served as the Global Strategist for DevRel Events and Sponsorship at Mozilla, investing in projects and platforms that connect millions of developers annually on the web and onsite at conferences. Having served many years as an Advocate, then Director, for Women Who Code, Sandra currently serves on the Advisory Board and speaks on the importance of women in leadership roles, including within the ever-evolving business of developer relations at industry events. Sandra earned her MBA in Management Consulting at Cornell University and her BA at Wellesley College. She once had the title of frequent flier with multiple international airlines and now enjoys best long weekends at home with her boys and family on the West Coast. Read more of her musings on https://medium.com/@SandraPersing
